intro: Erigeron longipes, commonly known as the long-peduncled blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It features slender, hairy stems and produces showy blue to purple flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, with a rough texture.
